Quantitative Aptitude.question: What is the value of 25% of 200?
A train 150 m long is running at 60 km/hr. How much time will it take to cross a pole?
If the cost price of 15 items is equal to the selling price of 12 items, then the gain percent is:
A man can row 5 km/h in still water. If the stream flows at 1 km/h, then the time taken to row to a place 6 km upstream and back is:
If 3x + 2 = 11, what is the value of x?
What will be the compound interest on ₹2500 for 2 years at 4% per annum?
The average of first 10 natural numbers is:
The ratio of the ages of two brothers is 4:5 and the elder one is 20 years old. What is the age of the younger brother?
If a number is increased by 20% it becomes 180. What is the original number?
A shopkeeper allows a discount of 10% on the marked price. What price should be marked on an article that costs him ₹450 to gain 20%?

Logical Reasoning.question: Find the next number in the series: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?
Which word does NOT belong to the group?
If TABLE is coded as GZOOV, then CHAIR is coded as:
Statements: All pens are books. All books are papers. Conclusions: I. All pens are papers. II. All papers are pens.
If in a certain code, BREAD is written as 51234 and BUTTER as 516678, then DEAR will be written as:
Which number is the odd one out: 121, 144, 169, 196, 225, 242
If CLOCK is written as KCOLC, how will TIME be written?
Which letter will be the 5th to the right of the 14th letter from the left in the English alphabet?

Verbal Ability.question: Fill in the blank: He has been working here _____ five years.
Identify the synonym of the word 'Benevolent':
Choose the word which is opposite in meaning to 'Conceal':
Choose the correct passive voice: 'They are playing football.'
options: Football was being played by them.
Football is being played by them.
Football has been played by them.
Football had been played by them.
Verbal Ability.correctAnswer: Football is being played by them.

Verbal Ability.question: Spot the error: 'He don't like coffee.'
Complete the sentence: If I were you, I _____ that job.
Choose the correct one-word substitution: 'One who can speak two languages.'
Choose the appropriate preposition: He is afraid _____ the dark.

Data Interpreatation.question: Study the table and answer: What was the total sales of Product B over the 5 years?
Based on the data: Which year showed the maximum growth in Product A?
Pie chart shows company expense breakdown. If total expenses are $1,000,000 and marketing is 25%, how much is spent on marketing?
Bar chart shows sales of five books. If Book A sold 3000, Book B 4500, Book C 2500, Book D 5000, Book E 4000, which book had second highest sales?
A line graph shows monthly visitors to a website. If January = 1000, February = 1200, March = 1100, April = 1500. What is the average monthly visitors?
From the given data, in which year was the revenue-to-cost ratio the highest?
If a pie chart shows 40% production from Unit A and total production is 20,000 units, what is Unit A’s production?
Table shows student counts in 3 departments: CS-120, ECE-100, ME-80. What is the percentage of CS students?
A bar chart shows rainfall in cm for 5 months: Jan=10, Feb=15, Mar=12, Apr=8, May=20. Which month had least rainfall?
Line graph shows profit per quarter: Q1=20k, Q2=25k, Q3=30k, Q4=35k. What is total annual profit?

Arithmetic.question: If a shirt costs ₹480 after a 20% discount, what was its original price?
What is the simple interest on ₹2000 at 5% per annum for 3 years?
If the average of 5 numbers is 20, what is their total sum?
What is the next number in the sequence: 2, 4, 8, 16, ___?
A train covers 360 km in 6 hours. What is its average speed?
If 3 pencils cost ₹18, what is the cost of 10 pencils?
A number when divided by 5 leaves a remainder of 3. What is the remainder when the same number is divided by 10?

Number Series.question: What comes next in the series: 2, 4, 8, 16, ?

Time & Work.question: A can complete a work in 12 days and B in 16 days. In how many days will they complete the work together?
A is twice as good a workman as B. Together they finish a job in 12 days. In how many days will A alone do the job?
B alone can do a work in 12 days, and A is 50% more efficient than B. How long will A alone take to complete the work?
A and B can do a work in 10 days, and B and C in 12 days. A and C can do it in 15 days. In how many days can A alone do it?
If 6 men can complete a work in 12 days, how many men are required to complete it in 8 days?
A can do a work in 15 days, B in 20 days. They worked together for 4 days. How much work is left?
If A can do a work in 10 days and B in 5 days, in how many days can they do it together?
C is thrice as fast as A. If A can finish a work in 30 days, how many days will C take?
A and B can complete a work in 8 days. B alone can do it in 12 days. In how many days can A alone do it?
A can finish a work in 18 days. He worked for 6 days and left. B completed the remaining work in 12 days. In how many days can B complete the whole work?

Profit & Loss.question: A shopkeeper buys an article for ₹500 and sells it for ₹600. What is the profit percentage?
If an item is sold at a loss of 10%, and the selling price is ₹180, what was the cost price?
If the cost price of 15 articles is equal to the selling price of 12 articles, what is the profit percentage?
An article is sold for ₹240 at a loss of 20%. What is the cost price?
A man sells two items for ₹1000 each, one at a profit of 10% and the other at a loss of 10%. What is the overall profit or loss?
If the selling price of an article is 125% of its cost price, what is the profit percentage?
An article is marked at ₹500 and sold at ₹450. What is the discount percentage?
A dealer marks his goods 20% above cost price and allows a discount of 10%. What is his gain percentage?
A man bought a pen for ₹50 and sold it for ₹65. What is the profit percentage?
If there is a loss of 20% on cost price, what percent is the loss on the selling price?

Percentages.question: If 30% of a number is 60, what is the number?
A number is increased by 20% and then decreased by 20%. What is the net percentage change?
If the price of a commodity increases from ₹500 to ₹600, what is the percentage increase?
What is the percentage change when a number increases from 40 to 50?
If 60% of the students in a class are boys, and there are 24 boys, how many students are there in total?
A man spends 85% of his income. If he saves ₹2,250, what is his income?
If a number is 20% more than another, how much percent is the second number less than the first?
60% of students passed in English, 70% in Math and 20% failed in both. What percentage passed in at least one?

Probability.question: What is the probability of getting a head when tossing a fair coin?
A bag contains 3 red and 2 green balls. One ball is drawn at random. What is the probability that it is green?
A die is rolled once. What is the probability of getting an even number?
If two coins are tossed simultaneously, what is the probability of getting exactly one head?
A card is drawn from a well-shuffled pack of 52 cards. What is the probability of drawing a king?
A number is selected at random from 1 to 10. What is the probability that it is a prime number?
What is the probability of choosing a vowel randomly from the English alphabet?
If a box contains 4 blue, 3 red, and 3 green balls, what is the probability of drawing a red ball?
A letter is chosen at random from the word 'PROBABILITY'. What is the probability that it is a vowel?
In a class of 40 students, 25 like football, 15 like basketball, and 5 like both. If a student is picked at random, what is the probability they like either football or basketball?
